headline: Wall Street Overcame This Year's Slowdown Predictions
summary: The 2025 slowdown foreseen by many on Wall Street never materialized in full. Tariff exemptions and a slew of trade deals have limited the inflationary effects of the highest import taxes in decades. And an artificial-intelligence arms race has triggered a capital-spending boom, propelling growth, minting millionaires—and leaving the U.

headline: How AI productivity is reshaping the Fed’s 2026 economic outlook
summary: Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast. One word may explain the market’s next big move: productivity.In this episode of Stocks in Translation, Fundstrat economic strategist Hardika Singh joins host Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to discuss productivity in the AI era. Singh explains why the Federal Reserve is increasingly confident that AI is boosting output without stoking inflation, lifting growth expectations for 2026. The group also breaks down what productivity means for corporate profits, the labor market, and high-beta AI winners like Micron (MU), where rapid gains come with elevated risk.Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service. This post was written by Lauren Pokedoff

headline: Why Micron is the hottest AI stock right now
summary: Listen and subscribe to Stocks In Translation on Apple Podcasts, Spotify, or wherever you find your favorite podcast.Investors can’t stop talking about Micron (MU), and here’s why…In this episode of Stocks in Translation, Fundstrat economic strategist Hardika Singh joins host Jared Blikre and Yahoo Finance Senior Reporter Brooke DiPalma to discuss to discuss Micron in relation to the concept of beta. The memory chipmaker’s stock has more than tripled this year, reflecting its high-beta status and exposure to AI demand. Singh explains how Micron’s DRAM and high-bandwidth memory for AI data centers are driving prices and revenue, while highlighting the risks of volatile swings in this niche, fast-growing market. Check out the full episode here. Twice a week, Stocks In Translation cuts through the market mayhem, noisy numbers and hyperbole to give you the information you need to make the right trade for your portfolio. You can find more episodes here, or watch on your favorite streaming service. This post was written by Lauren Pokedoff

summary: These ten large-cap stocks were top performers last week. Are they a part of your portfolio? Also, Needham analyst Ryan Koontz maintained a Buy rating, raising the price forecast from $63 to $90. Lumentum Holdings Inc. (NASDAQ:LITE) gained 14.76% this week B
